alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Florence (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 11 at 10:42PM EST until February 16 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina...South Carolina... Lumber River Near Lumberton affecting Robeson County. Black Creek At Quinby affecting Darlington and Florence Counties. For the Lumber River...including Nichols, Lumberton Usgs Gage, Pembroke, Maxton, Lumberton, Boardman...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Black Creek...including Quinby, Black Creek Nr Hartsville... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black Creek At Quinby. * WHEN...From Sunday morning to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, Floodwaters spill over into yards of all residences on Creekside Drive. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EST Saturday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Monday morning to a crest of 12.0 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Black Creek Quinby 10.0 6.0 Sat 9 am EST 9.3 12.0 11.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=ilm . The next statement will be issued by Sunday morning.
